New Records: St. Louis Cardinals' Jordan Walker went 5-for-5 with a home run, three RBI, and four runs, becoming the first player in nearly 100 years to do so against the New York Yankees. He also stole a base, a feat not achieved by Al Simmons or Jimmy Dykes in the same game since 1929.
Key Match Events: Jordan Walker's historic 5-for-5 performance with a home run, three RBI, four runs, and a stolen base was a standout event in the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the first time in nearly 100 years a player had achieved such a stat line against the Yankees.
